result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael D Perkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Perkins

Reporter:  digital recorder - 3:27
Defendant in court with Attorney Tracey J Lencioni.  Shaun W O'Connell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest on Count 1; Counts 2 & 3 dismissed & read-in.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Drug Diversion Program. Drug Court Diversion Contract signed.  Bail continued.  Review hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.
